intro: Angraecopsis thouarsii, commonly known as the Madagascar star orchid, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, with a distinctive central spur that houses the nectar. Angraecopsis thouarsii is noted for its unique pollination mechanism, attracting specific nocturnal moths.
